sentence.text: They were there to be beseeched and entreated for their protection and aid in adversity , but what if they failed ?
` If I tread too presumptuously into sacred places , reprove me , " entreated the earl , with the submissive sweetness of a brand-new novice .
Miracles can be worked by Him alone , although mere mortals may entreat Him by prayer to perform them on their behalf .
` Pallas can not appease Olympian Zeus , though entreating him with many words and deep wisdom .
He entreated Haydn to overlook those faults which may have escaped ` a father 's biased eye " , and begged him to continue his friendship towards ` one who values it so highly " .
If you have a dog that behaves in this fashion , do not encourage it by making soothing noises , entreating it to calm down .
And he beseeched me to entreat your Majesties To hear and see the matter .
Strapping himself into the vacated chair , he entreated Rogal Dorn to guide him -- then emptied his mind of all but titanic tech thoughts .
In the lifetime of the current Westminster parliament , it appears inconceivable that the Government will go beyond its existing words to entreat Sinn Fein to parley .
` My lord , I entreat you to believe that what you find in this letter was honestly written and honestly meant .
Amelia fluttered against his lips , entreating to be let back in .
Shouldst thou not cry aloud , and show them their transgressions ; and entreat and beseech them as for life and death ? ' "
When A sees B in grievous distress , his conscience always urges him to entreat C to help him . "
Themis describes various rain-making rites , including a Christianized one which involves entreating ` S. John Baptist to baptize the Holy Child " .
` Oh come on , " he entreated .
` Just go away , will you ? " she entreated wearily .
" What have you in mind ? " she entreated .
How one afternoon in the blaze of the Highland summer one of the airmen roused the corporal and entreated : " What do you make of yon ? "
Following the experience of the war , when Britain came close to running out of food , farmers were entreated by successive governments to increase production .
I have been intreated during these weeks , cajoled , wheedled , almost caressed , tortured , threatened , brow-beaten and all but blackmailed to step in as the saviour of society . "
` The Tommie Atkins they introduce " , he insisted , ` is a drunken , swearing , coarse-minded Hooligan , for whom , nevertheless , our sympathy is eagerly entreated . "
They think of their children 's warm squirming bodies and entreat that as they grow up they will not be hurt as they have been -- ;
` No , do n't be so quick to offence , " entreated Harry hastily .

Therefore I am entreating you most earnestly to send me those men you aught to send , well armed , as soon as possible as we are going to assemble beside Colrane and the general is to come shortly to make a muster there [ to fight the Irish rebels ] .
She turned to him , lips slightly parted , eyes wide , entreating him .
